sourceMeaningMnemonic: Whatever people <radical>say</radical> to you will be carved by a <radical>blade</radical> into your <radical>heart</radical>. Sounds cruel, but it's a way to make you <kanji>recognize</kanji> their power.
meaningInfo: How could you not acknowledge somebody if every word they said was carved into your heart? It's not particularly painful, but it does make you quite uncomfortable.
readingMnemonic: Having their words carved into your heart makes you <kanji>recognize</kanji> the authority of many people. But the only one you could ever truly <kanji>acknowledge</kanji>, is <reading>Nin</reading>tendo (<ja>にん<ja>).
readingInfo: You're one of the biggest Nintendo fans out there, so how could you not acknowledge their greatness? No matter what is carved into your heart, Nintendo will always occupy a special place.
